Description: Round-topped limestone stela divided into five registers within a striated border: 1 - Wedjat-eyes. 2 - Seated figure with a sceptre before offerings; two rows of Hieroglyphic text above. 3, 4 + 5 - Figures kneeling before offering-tables separated by columns of Hieroglyphic text.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1912 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 3. (pl.29)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2014-2015 9 Oct-26 Jan. Palais des Beaux Arts de Lille. Senusret III.
